body.p:
Mt. Vernon Ky
June 7th 1864
His Excellency
Thos, E, Bramlett

Dear Govenor Sometime Since the grand Jury of This (Rockcastle County) found an Indictment against each of us for gameing at cards; and at the Last Term of the Circuit Court we entered the plea of guilty and Judgment went against us Seperate for $30, We were all in the same game and say to you on the honor of Gentlemen that the game was not for proffit neither from any disposition to violate Law but for mere past time to pass of dull hours.. And as times are hard we appeal to you for releif hopeing that you will extend your clemency remit the fine against us and we will do so no more

Samuel H. Thompson
Jack Adams
R G McKee

Dear Governor; are clever gentlemen That appeal to you for remit once of their fines against them and I hope your Excellency will remit each of them the amt would be of no material benefit to the State and an inquery to them

I am with high regard
your obt sevt.
Charles Kirtley
We the undersigned citizens of Mr Vernon and Rockcastle County unite in the wish that your Excellency will remit the fines against S H Thompson, Jack Adams and R L McKee

Most Truly yours
F B McClary
J. E. Nagle
M. J. Miller
J. C. Carter
Jos C Jones
E T Fish
J. J. Williams

Rockcastle Cir Ct
vs
S. H. Thompson
J. Adams & R. G. McKee

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
June 9th 1864

$20. each
Remission filled & forwarded & entrd upon Journal
E L V
Secty
